title: Authors and Citation
text: James O. Uanhoro. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Uanhoro JO (2023). “Modeling misspecification parameter Bayesian structural equation modeling.” Educational Psychological Measurement. doi:10.1177/00131644231165306. Uanhoro JO (2022). “Hierarchical Covariance Estimation Approach Meta-Analytic Structural Equation Modeling.” Structural Equation Modeling: Multidisciplinary Journal, 1–15. doi:10.1080/10705511.2022.2142128.
code: @Article{,   title = {Modeling misspecification as a parameter in Bayesian structural equation modeling},   author = {James O. Uanhoro},   journal = {Educational and Psychological Measurement},   year = {2023},   doi = {10.1177/00131644231165306}, } @Article{,   title = {Hierarchical Covariance Estimation Approach to Meta-Analytic Structural Equation Modeling},   author = {James O. Uanhoro},   journal = {Structural Equation Modeling: A Multidisciplinary Journal},   year = {2022},   pages = {1--15},   doi = {10.1080/10705511.2022.2142128}, }

title: Fit Bayesian structural equation models under the assumption that minor factors exist
text: Goals Permitted models supported data types Installation Model comparisons Different methods capture influence minor factors Meta-analytic CFA Citations

title: Fit Bayesian structural equation models under the assumption that minor factors exist
text: rare structural equation models (SEMs) able reject null hypothesis misspecification model. One explanation problem covariance structures influenced major factors can hypothesize minor factors predict -priori, e.g. MacCallum Tucker (1991).

title: Fit Bayesian structural equation models under the assumption that minor factors exist
text: goal minorbsem let fit Bayesian SEMs estimate influence minor factors covariance matrix following approach Uanhoro (2023). Briefly, residual covariances estimated priors shrink towards zero, model returns magnitude influence minor factors. minorbsem also fits random-effects meta-analytic CFAs capture influence minor factors following approach Uanhoro (2022).

what: Permitted models and supported data types
title: Fit Bayesian structural equation models under the assumption that minor factors exist
text: package fits limited number model configurations: CFA, allowing cross-loadings (may automatically estimated), correlated errors terms, fully oblique orthogonal factors (useful fitting bifactor models) SEMs allowing latent regressions (), cross-loadings, correlated error terms. One fit MIMIC, multi-group models, multilevel models, models specially constrained parameters (e.g. setting two parameters equal). meta-analysis models CFA configurations. data assumed multivariate normal, .e. binary, ordinal models.

title: Fit Bayesian structural equation models under the assumption that minor factors exist
text: Install minorbsem:
code: install.packages(   'minorbsem',   repos = c(     'https://jamesuanhoro.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org'   ) )

title: Fit Bayesian structural equation models under the assumption that minor factors exist
code: library(minorbsem) # Basic Holzinger-Swineford model syntax_1 <- " F1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3 F2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6 F3 =~ x7 + x8 + x9" # Expect a summary table output fit_1 <- minorbsem(syntax_1, HS)  # Save output table to html file, see: ?pretty_print_summary for more options pretty_print_summary(fit_1, save_html = "baseline_model.html")  # Histogram of parameters, see: ?parameter_hist for arguments parameter_hist(fit_1)  # Traceplot of parameters, see: ?parameter_trace for arguments parameter_trace(fit_1)  # Examine all standardized residual covariances plot_residuals(fit_1) plot_residuals(fit_1, type = "range")

title: Fit Bayesian structural equation models under the assumption that minor factors exist
text: Fit second model estimates cross-loadings shrinks 0 using global-local prior (simple_struc = FALSE). compare models using LOO. needs loo package: install.packages("loo").
code: fit_2 <- minorbsem(syntax_1, HS, simple_struc = FALSE)  # Compute case wise log-likelihood # exclude minor factor influences or else both models will fit data equally ll_mat_1 <- casewise_log_likelihood(fit_1, include_residuals = FALSE) ll_mat_2 <- casewise_log_likelihood(fit_2, include_residuals = FALSE) chain_id <- posterior::as_draws_df(fit_1@stan_fit)$.chain  # loo for model 1 loo_1 <- loo::loo(   ll_mat_1,   r_eff = loo::relative_eff(ll_mat_1, chain_id = chain_id) ) print(loo_1)  # loo for model 2 loo_2 <- loo::loo(   ll_mat_2,   r_eff = loo::relative_eff(ll_mat_2, chain_id = chain_id) ) print(loo_2)  # Compare both models print(loo::loo_compare(loo_1, loo_2), simplify = FALSE)

what: Different methods to capture the influence of minor factors
title: Fit Bayesian structural equation models under the assumption that minor factors exist
text: Default method method = "normal" assuming standardized residual covariances average 0 vary 0 continuous fashion. methods, see details section ?minorbsem. Model comparison via LOO works first example.
code: ## Fit same model as above but use global-local prior to estimate # minor factor influences fit_gdp <- minorbsem(syntax_1, HS, method = "GDP") plot_residuals(fit_gdp) parameter_hist(fit_gdp) parameter_trace(fit_gdp)  # Ignoring minor factor influences fit_reg <- minorbsem(syntax_1, HS, method = "none") parameter_hist(fit_reg) parameter_trace(fit_reg)  # Error!!!: Plotting residuals will give an error message # since minor factor influences are assumed null plot_residuals(fit_reg)

title: Fit Bayesian structural equation models under the assumption that minor factors exist
text: methods, see details section ?meta_mbcfa. Model comparisons yet implemented meta-analytic CFAs. Uanhoro (2022) addresses moderation (via meta-regression) missing data input covariances – yet implemented.
code: # An example in the metaSEM package, 11 studies, 9 items. model_syntax <- "# latent variable definitions F1 =~ JP1 + JP2 + JP3 F2 =~ JN1 + JN2 + JN4 + JN4 F3 =~ TD1 + TD2" meta_fit <- meta_mbcfa(   model_syntax,   sample_cov = issp89$data, sample_nobs = issp89$n )  # Histogram of parameters, see: ?parameter_hist for arguments parameter_hist(meta_fit)  # Traceplot of parameters, see: ?parameter_trace for arguments parameter_trace(meta_fit)  # Examine all standardized residual covariances plot_residuals(meta_fit) plot_residuals(meta_fit, type = "range")

what: Studies on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. — Norton13

code: Norton13

text: list data following structure: data list 28 studies correlation matrices. variables 14 items (x1 x14) measuring HADS n vector sample sizes population vector population data group vector classification patients vs. non-patients based population

text: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/metaSEM/index.html

title: Studies on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. — Norton13
text: Cheung MW (2015). “metaSEM: R Package Meta-Analysis using Structural Equation Modeling.” Frontiers Psychology, 5(1521). doi:10.3389/fpsyg.2014.01521 . Norton S, Cosco T, Doyle F, Done J, Sacker (2013). “Hospital Anxiety Depression Scale: meta confirmatory factor analysis.” Journal Psychosomatic Research, 74(1), 74--81. ISSN 0022-3999, doi:10.1016/j.jpsychores.2012.10.010 .

what: Get casewise log-likelihood when full data is available — casewise_log_likelihood
title: Get casewise log-likelihood when full data is available — casewise_log_likelihood
text: Get casewise log-likelihood complete data, useful WAIC, LOOIC, ... work meta-analysis models.

title: Get casewise log-likelihood when full data is available — casewise_log_likelihood
code: casewise_log_likelihood(   object,   include_residuals = FALSE,   use_armadillo = TRUE )

title: Get casewise log-likelihood when full data is available — casewise_log_likelihood
text: object (mbsem) object mbsem-class returned minorbsem. include_residuals (LOGICAL) TRUE: Include minor factor residual covariances model-implied covariance matrix; FALSE: Exclude . TRUE, different models fit data hardly distinguishable. See details . use_armadillo (LOGICAL) TRUE: Use RccpArmadillo log-likelihood computations. FALSE: Use base R implementation bayesm package.

title: Get casewise log-likelihood when full data is available — casewise_log_likelihood
text: matrix (posterior iterations sample size) containing log-likelihood

title: Get casewise log-likelihood when full data is available — casewise_log_likelihood
text: comparing two models fit using method minorbsem, reasonable exclude residual covariance matrix captures influences minor factors computing log-likelihood. excluded, log-likelihood near identical models different structures. minor factor residual covariances capture degree misspecification hypothesized structure. option set include_residuals = TRUE included allow () comparison models fit different minorbsem methods ; (ii) comparisons models fit minorbsem models fit packages. influence minor factors non-trivial, one can expect models fit minorbsem better fit data models fit packages since minorbsem models simultaneously model degree model misspecification.

title: Get casewise log-likelihood when full data is available — casewise_log_likelihood
code: if (FALSE) { # Comparing two models using LOOCV fit_1 <- minorbsem("F1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3                     F2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6                     F3 =~ x7 + x8 + x9", HS) # Compute case wise log-likelihood, exclude minor factor residuals ll_mat_1 <- casewise_log_likelihood(fit_1, include_residuals = FALSE) chain_id <- posterior::as_draws_df(fit_1@stan_fit)$.chain fit_2 <- minorbsem("F1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3 + x9                     F2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6                     F3 =~ x7 + x8 + x9", HS) # Compute case wise log-likelihood, exclude minor factor residuals ll_mat_2 <- casewise_log_likelihood(fit_2, include_residuals = FALSE)  # LOO compuations loo_1 <- loo::loo(   ll_mat_1,   r_eff = loo::relative_eff(ll_mat_1, chain_id = chain_id) ) print(loo_1) loo_2 <- loo::loo(   ll_mat_2,   r_eff = loo::relative_eff(ll_mat_2, chain_id = chain_id) ) print(loo_2)  # Compare both models print(loo::loo_compare(loo_1, loo_2), simplify = FALSE) }

title: Stan data helper function — create_data_list
text: lavaan_object lavaan fit object corresponding model method (character) One "normal", "lasso", "logistic", "GDP", "WB", "WB-cond", "none" simple_struc (LOGICAL) relevant CFAs. TRUE: assume simple structure; FALSE: estimate cross-loadings using generalized double Pareto priors. priors object mbsempriors-class. See new_mbsempriors information.

title: Stan data helper function — create_data_list

title: Stan data helper function — create_data_list_meta
code: create_data_list_meta(   lavaan_object = NULL,   method = "normal",   type = "re",   simple_struc = TRUE,   priors = NULL,   cluster = NULL )

title: Stan data helper function — create_data_list_meta
text: lavaan_object lavaan fit object corresponding model method (character) One "normal", "lasso", "logistic", "GDP", "none". See details . type (character) One "fe", "re", "dep" fixed-effects, random-effects, dependent-samples MASEM respectively. "dep" argument experimental, see details . simple_struc (LOGICAL) relevant CFAs. TRUE: assume simple structure; FALSE: estimate cross-loadings using generalized double Pareto priors. priors object mbsempriors-class. See new_mbsempriors information. cluster optional integer vector identifying cluster group belongs . Asssume five groups, first three belong cluster 1 last two belong cluster 2, argument : cluster = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2). feature experimental, see details .

title: Class
text: mbsem class represents fitted model.   contains summary statistics structural parameters,   summary statistics standardized residual covariances,   data used fit model, fitted Stan model.

title: Class
text: Objects can created calls minorbsem   meta_mbcfa function.

title: Class
text: major_parameters: Summary statistics structural parameters minor_factor_matrix: Summary statistics standardized residual covariances data_list: Data used fit model priors: Priors used fit model stan_fit: Fitted RStan CmdStan model version: Package version used fit model

title: Class
text: logLik signature(object = "mbsem", include_residuals = FALSE):       Returns casewise log-likelihood long full data available.       include_residuals = FALSE ensures minor factor residual       covariances included computing log-likelihood.       See casewise_log_likelihood details. fitted signature(object = "mbsem", include_residuals = TRUE):       Returns posterior distribution model-implied covariance matrix       #(iterations) #(items ^ 2) matrix.       include_residuals = TRUE, includes residual covariances induced       minor factors.       include_residuals = FALSE, excludes residual covariances induced       minor factors. residuals signature(object = "mbsem", standardized = TRUE):       Returns posterior distribution residual covariances reflecting influences       minor factors #(iterations) #(items ^ 2) matrix.       standardized = TRUE, returns standardized residual covariances.       standardized = FALSE, returns UNstandardized residual covariances. show signature(object = "mbsem"):       Pretty printing model results.       See pretty_print_summary printing options.

title: Class
code: if (FALSE) {     fit_1 <- minorbsem("F1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3                         F2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6                         F3 =~ x7 + x8 + x9", HS)     # Model-implied covariances     mod_imp_cov <- fitted(fit_1)     # Get average of model-implied covariance matrix     matrix(colMeans(mod_imp_cov), nrow = fit_1@data_list$Ni)   }

what: A class for setting up priors. — mbsempriors-class
title: A class for setting up priors. — mbsempriors-class
text: class setting priors.

title: A class for setting up priors. — mbsempriors-class
text: lkj_shape (positive real) shape parameter LKJ-prior interfactor correlation matrix confirmatory factor models. sl_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(df = 3, loc = 0) prior hyper-parameter standard deviation loadings. rs_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(df = 3, loc = 0) prior residual standard deviations. rc_par (positive real) shape parameter Beta(rc_par, rc_par) prior residual error correlations. sc_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(df = 3, loc = 0) prior hyper-parameter standard deviations coefficients; SD(coefs) vary outcome. fc_par (positive real) shape parameter Beta(rc_par, rc_par) prior inter-factor correlations latent regression models. mln_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(df = 3, loc = 0) prior log-scale meta-regression intercept. Relevant meta-analysis. mlb_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(df = 3, loc = 0) prior log-scale meta-regression coefficients. Relevant meta-analysis.

what: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — meta_mbcfa
title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — meta_mbcfa
text: function fit fixed- random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs minor factors assumed (Uanhoro 2022) . Builds work Wu Browne (2015) . yet accomodate moderators, covariance matrices must complete. change near future.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — meta_mbcfa
code: meta_mbcfa(   model = NULL,   data = NULL,   group = NULL,   sample_cov = NULL,   sample_nobs = NULL,   method = "normal",   type = "re",   orthogonal = FALSE,   simple_struc = TRUE,   seed = 12345,   warmup = 1000,   sampling = 1000,   refresh = (warmup + sampling)/10,   adapt_delta = 0.9,   max_treedepth = 10,   chains = 4,   ncores = max(parallel::detectCores() - 2, 1),   priors = new_mbsempriors(),   show = TRUE,   show_messages = TRUE,   cluster = NULL,   target = "rstan" )

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — meta_mbcfa
text: model description user-specified model, lavaan syntax. data optional data frame containing observed variables used model. group optional string identifying grouping variable data object. sample_cov (list matrices) sample variance-covariance matrices. rownames /colnames must contain observed variable names. now, assumes missing elements covariance matrices. sample_nobs (vector positive integer) Number observations study. method (character) One "normal", "lasso", "logistic", "GDP", "none". See details . type (character) One "fe", "re", "dep" fixed-effects, random-effects, dependent-samples MASEM respectively. "dep" argument experimental, see details . orthogonal (logical) constrain factors orthogonal, must TRUE fit bifactor models. simple_struc (LOGICAL) relevant CFAs. TRUE: assume simple structure; FALSE: estimate cross-loadings using generalized double Pareto priors. seed (positive integer) seed, set obtain replicable results. warmup (positive integer) number warmup iterations run per chain. sampling (positive integer) number post-warmup iterations run per chain, retained inference. refresh (positive integer) often print status sampler. adapt_delta (real (0, 1)) Increase resolve divergent transitions. max_treedepth (positive integer) Increase resolve problems maximum tree depth. chains (positive integer) number Markov chains run. ncores (positive integer) number chains run parallel. priors object mbsempriors-class. See new_mbsempriors information. show (Logical) TRUE, show table results, FALSE, show table results. example, use FALSE simulation studies. show_messages (Logical) TRUE, show messages Stan sampler, FALSE, hide messages. cluster optional integer vector identifying cluster group belongs . Asssume five groups, first three belong cluster 1 last two belong cluster 2, argument : cluster = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2). feature experimental, see details . target (character) One "rstan" "cmdstan". "cmdstan", CmdStan CmdStanR need installed device.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — meta_mbcfa
text: object mbsem-class

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — meta_mbcfa
text: CFAs assume standardized factors. Latent variable regression models yet implemented. different methods estimating models package: normal: belief minor factor influences average zero continuous deviations away zero. lasso: belief minor factor influences largely zero small number non-zero residual covariances. logistic: similar belief normal readily accomodates extreme outliers. GDP: mimic global-local approach, .e. attempt shrink near 0 residual covariances 0 minimal shrinking larger residual covariances (Armagan et al. 2013) . none: intending ignore influence minor factors. type = "dep", user must supply cluster IDs, see cluster parameter documentation . However, feature experimental available target = "cmdstan". Additionally, cluster inputs validated.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — meta_mbcfa
text: Armagan , Dunson DB, Lee J (2013). “Generalized double Pareto shrinkage.” Statistica Sinica, 23(1), 119--143. ISSN 1017-0405, https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3903426/. Uanhoro JO (2022). “Hierarchical Covariance Estimation Approach Meta-Analytic Structural Equation Modeling.” Structural Equation Modeling: Multidisciplinary Journal, 0(0), 1--15. ISSN 1070-5511, doi:10.1080/10705511.2022.2142128 . Wu H, Browne MW (2015). “Quantifying Adventitious Error Covariance Structure Random Effect.” Psychometrika, 80(3), 571--600. ISSN 1860-0980, doi:10.1007/s11336-015-9451-3 .

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — meta_mbcfa
code: if (FALSE) { model_syntax <- "# latent variable definitions F1 =~ JP1 + JP2 + JP3 F2 =~ JN1 + JN2 + JN4 + JN4 F3 =~ TD1 + TD2" meta_mbcfa(   model_syntax,   sample_cov = issp89$data, sample_nobs = issp89$n ) model_syntax <- paste0(   "distress =~ ", paste0("x", 1:14, collapse = " + "), "\n",   "anxiety =~ ", paste0("x", seq(1, 14, 2), collapse = " + "), "\n",   "depression =~ ", paste0("x", seq(2, 14, 2), collapse = " + ") ) meta_mbcfa(   model_syntax,   sample_cov = Norton13$data, sample_nobs = Norton13$n, orthogonal = TRUE ) }

what: Fit Bayesian SEMs with minor factors assumed — minorbsem
title: Fit Bayesian SEMs with minor factors assumed — minorbsem
text: major function fit models assuming influence minor factors (Uanhoro 2023) .

title: Fit Bayesian SEMs with minor factors assumed — minorbsem
code: minorbsem(   model = NULL,   data = NULL,   sample_cov = NULL,   sample_nobs = NULL,   method = "normal",   orthogonal = FALSE,   simple_struc = TRUE,   seed = 12345,   warmup = 1000,   sampling = 1000,   refresh = (warmup + sampling)/10,   adapt_delta = 0.9,   max_treedepth = 10,   chains = 4,   ncores = max(parallel::detectCores() - 2, 1),   priors = new_mbsempriors(),   show = TRUE,   show_messages = TRUE,   target = "rstan" )

title: Fit Bayesian SEMs with minor factors assumed — minorbsem
text: model description user-specified model, lavaan syntax. data optional data frame containing observed variables used model. sample_cov (matrix) sample variance-covariance matrix. rownames /colnames must contain observed variable names. sample_nobs (positive integer) Number observations full data frame missing sample covariance matrix given. method (character) One "normal", "lasso", "logistic", "GDP", "WB", "WB-cond", "none". See details . orthogonal (logical) constrain factors orthogonal, must TRUE fit bifactor models. simple_struc (LOGICAL) relevant CFAs. TRUE: assume simple structure; FALSE: estimate cross-loadings using generalized double Pareto priors. seed (positive integer) seed, set obtain replicable results. warmup (positive integer) number warmup iterations run per chain. sampling (positive integer) number post-warmup iterations run per chain, retained inference. refresh (positive integer) often print status sampler. adapt_delta (real (0, 1)) Increase resolve divergent transitions. max_treedepth (positive integer) Increase resolve problems maximum tree depth. chains (positive integer) number Markov chains run. ncores (positive integer) number chains run parallel. priors object mbsempriors-class. See new_mbsempriors information. show (Logical) TRUE, show table results, FALSE, show table results. example, use FALSE simulation studies. show_messages (Logical) TRUE, show messages Stan sampler, FALSE, hide messages. target (character) One "rstan" "cmdstan". "cmdstan", CmdStan CmdStanR need installed device.

title: Fit Bayesian SEMs with minor factors assumed — minorbsem
text: object mbsem-class

title: Fit Bayesian SEMs with minor factors assumed — minorbsem
text: CFAs assume standardized factors. Latent variable regression models print results standardized loadings. different methods estimating models package: normal: belief minor factor influences average zero continuous deviations away zero (Uanhoro 2023) . lasso: belief minor factor influences largely zero small number non-zero residual covariances. logistic: similar belief normal readily accomodates extreme outliers. GDP: mimic global-local approach, .e. attempt shrink near 0 residual covariances 0 minimal shrinking larger residual covariances (Armagan et al. 2013) . WB: model covariance matrix hierarchically assumptions adventitiuous error (Wu Browne 2015) ; allow computation casewise log-likelihoods LOO-CV. WB-cond: WB estimates "population covariance matrix", allowing computation casewise log-likelihoods LOO-CV. none: intending ignore influence minor factors.

title: Fit Bayesian SEMs with minor factors assumed — minorbsem
text: Armagan , Dunson DB, Lee J (2013). “Generalized double Pareto shrinkage.” Statistica Sinica, 23(1), 119--143. ISSN 1017-0405, https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3903426/. Uanhoro JO (2023). “Modeling Misspecification Parameter Bayesian Structural Equation Models.” Educational Psychological Measurement, 0(0), 00131644231165306. ISSN 0013-1644, doi:10.1177/00131644231165306 , https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/00131644231165306. Wu H, Browne MW (2015). “Quantifying Adventitious Error Covariance Structure Random Effect.” Psychometrika, 80(3), 571--600. ISSN 1860-0980, doi:10.1007/s11336-015-9451-3 .

title: Fit Bayesian SEMs with minor factors assumed — minorbsem
code: if (FALSE) { minorbsem("# latent variable definitions            F1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3            F2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6            F3 =~ x7 + x8 + x9", HS) minorbsem("# latent variable definitions            ind60 =~ x1 + x2 + x3            dem60 =~ y1 + y2 + y3 + y4            dem65 =~ y5 + y6 + y7 + y8            # latent regressions            dem60 ~ ind60            dem65 ~ ind60 + dem60", PD) }

title: Set priors in package — new_mbsempriors
code: new_mbsempriors(   lkj_shape = 2,   sl_par = 1,   rs_par = 2.5,   rc_par = 2,   sc_par = 1,   fc_par = 2,   mln_par = 2.5,   mlb_par = 1 )

title: Set priors in package — new_mbsempriors
text: lkj_shape (positive real) shape parameter LKJ-prior interfactor correlation matrix confirmatory factor models. sl_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(df = 3, loc = 0) prior hyper-parameter standard deviation loadings. rs_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(df = 3, loc = 0) prior residual standard deviations. rc_par (positive real) shape parameter Beta(rc_par, rc_par) prior residual error correlations. sc_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(df = 3, loc = 0) prior hyper-parameter standard deviations coefficients; SD(coefs) vary outcome. fc_par (positive real) shape parameter Beta(rc_par, rc_par) prior inter-factor correlations latent regression models. mln_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(df = 3, loc = 0) prior log-scale meta-regression intercept. Relevant meta-analysis. mlb_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(df = 3, loc = 0) prior log-scale meta-regression coefficients. Relevant meta-analysis.

title: Set priors in package — new_mbsempriors
text: object mbsempriors-class

title: Set priors in package — new_mbsempriors
code: # Change LKJ shape parameter only custom_priors <- new_mbsempriors(lkj_shape = 1.0) if (FALSE) { minorbsem("F1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3            F2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6            F3 =~ x7 + x8 + x9", HS,   priors = custom_priors ) }

title: Histogram of parameter posterior distribution — parameter_hist
text: object (mbsem) object mbsem-class returned minorbsem. param_type (string vector) Choose list options: "" = structural parameters; "rm" = Root Mean square error standardized residual covariances RMSEA meta-analysis; "lo" = LOadings; "ev" = Error Variances; "rc" = Residual Correlations; "fc" = Factor Correlations; "rsq" = latent variable R SQuare; "co" = latent regression COefficients; "re" = standardized REsidual covariances

text: ggplot object

title: Histogram of parameter posterior distribution — parameter_hist
code: if (FALSE) { fit <- minorbsem("F1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3                   F2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6                   F3 =~ x7 + x8 + x9", HS) parameter_hist(fit) parameter_hist(fit, param_type = "all") parameter_hist(fit, param_type = c("rm", "lo", "fc")) }

title: Pretty print model results — pretty_print_summary
code: pretty_print_summary(   object,   interval = 0.9,   digits = 3,   simple = TRUE,   save_html = NULL )

title: Pretty print model results — pretty_print_summary
text: object (mbsem) object mbsem-class returned minorbsem. interval (real (0, 1)) Credible interval return. digits (positive integer) Number decimal places print table simple (Logical) TRUE produce table less information parameters; FALSE: produces table information save_html (string) Optional file name save table HTML

title: Pretty print model results — pretty_print_summary
code: if (FALSE) { fit <- minorbsem("F1 =~ x1 + x2 + x3                   F2 =~ x4 + x5 + x6                   F3 =~ x7 + x8 + x9", HS) pretty_print_summary(fit) pretty_print_summary(fit, simple = FALSE) }

title: target fitter function — target_fitter
text: function takes user input fits Stan model.

title: target fitter function — target_fitter
code: target_fitter(   target,   data_list,   seed,   warmup,   sampling,   refresh,   adapt_delta,   max_treedepth,   chains,   ncores,   show_messages )

title: target fitter function — target_fitter
text: target (character) One "rstan" "cmdstan". "cmdstan", CmdStan CmdStanR need installed device. data_list Data list object passed Stan seed (positive integer) seed, set obtain replicable results. warmup (positive integer) number warmup iterations run per chain. sampling (positive integer) number post-warmup iterations run per chain, retained inference. refresh (positive integer) often print status sampler. adapt_delta (real (0, 1)) Increase resolve divergent transitions. max_treedepth (positive integer) Increase resolve problems maximum tree depth. chains (positive integer) number Markov chains run. ncores (positive integer) number chains run parallel. show_messages (Logical) TRUE, show messages Stan sampler, FALSE, hide messages.

title: target fitter function — target_fitter
text: Fitted Stan model
